section.name: JPA : Annotations
section.p: Java provides the ability to use annotations, and DataNucleus supports both JPA and JDO annotations. In this section we will document some of the more important JPA annotations. When selecting to use annotations please bear in mind the following :-

ul.li: You must have the datanucleus-api-jpa jar available in your CLASSPATH.
You must have the persistence-api (or javax.persistence) jar in your CLASSPATH since this provides the annotations

Annotations should really only be used for attributes of persistence that you won't be changing at deployment. Things such as table and column names shouldn't really be specified using annotations although it is permitted. Instead it would be better to put such information in an ORM file.
Annotations can be added in two places - for the class as a whole, or for a field in particular.
You can annotate fields or getters with field-level information. It doesn't matter which.
Annotations are prefixed by the @ symbol and can take properties (in brackets after the name, comma-separated)
JPA doesn't provide for some key JDO concepts and DataNucleus provides its own annotations for these cases.
You have to import "javax.persistence.XXX" where XXX is the annotation name of a JPA annotation
You have to import "org.datanucleus.api.jpa.annotations.XXX" where XXX is the annotation name of a DataNucleus value-added annotation

section.p: Annotations supported by DataNucleus are shown below. Not all have their documentation written yet. The annotations/attributes coloured in brighter green are ORM and really should be placed in XML rather than directly in the class using annotations. The annotations coloured in blue are DataNucleus extensions and should be used only where you don't mind losing implementation-independence.

tr.td: Specifies that the class is persistent
Specifies that this class contains persistent information to be mapped
Specifies that the class is persistent embedded in another persistent class
Specifies that the class is not persistent but needs to be able to access fields of persistent classes (DataNucleus extension).
Defines the primary key class for this class
Specifies that instances of this class can be cached in the L2 cache
Defines a class as using datastore-identity (DataNucleus extension).
Defines a class as using nondurable identity (DataNucleus extension).
Specifies class(es) that are listeners for events from instances of this class
Defines a series of named JPQL queries for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a named JPQL query for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a named SQL query for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a series of named SQL queries for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a named stored procedure query for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a series of named stored procedure queries for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a result mapping for an SQL query for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a series of mappings for SQL queries for use in the current persistence unit
Defines a named entity graph with root of the class it is specifed on
Defines named entity graphs with root of the class it is specifed on
Defines a java type converter for a field type
Specifies the inheritance model for persisting this class
Defines the table where this class will be stored
Defines a secondary table where some fields of this class will be stored
Defines the column where any discriminator will be stored
Defines the value to be used in the discriminator for objects of this class
Defines the names of the PK columns when this class has a superclass
Defines the name of the PK column when this class has a superclass
Defines a field in a superclass that will have its column overridden
Defines the field(s) of superclasses that will have their columns overridden
Defines a N-1/1-1 field in a superclass that will have its column overridden
Defines the N-1/1-1 field(s) of superclasses that will have their columns overridden
Defines a generator of values using sequences in the datastore for use with persistent entities
Defines a generator of sequences using a table in the datastore for use with persistent entities
Defines this field as being embedded
Defines this field as being (part of) the identity for the class
Defines this field as being (part of) the identity for the class, and being embedded into this class.
Defines this field as storing the version for the class
Defines this field as being persistent
Defines this field as being transient (not persisted)
Defines this field as being a 1-1 relation with another persistent entity
Defines this field as being a 1-N relation with other persistent entities
Defines this field as being a M-N relation with other persistent entities
Defines this field as being a N-1 relation with another persistent entity
Defines this field as being a 1-N relation of Objects that are not Entities.
Specifies that the relation for this field/property is "shared" (DataNucleus extension).
Specifies an index on this field/property (DataNucleus extension).
Specifies the JDBC Type to use on this field/property (DataNucleus extension).
Specifies the column position to use on this field/property (DataNucleus extension).
Specifies a non-JPA-standard value generator to use on this field/property (DataNucleus extension).
Defines that this field has its value generated using a generator
Defines that this field is the key to a map
Defines the datastore type for the map key when it is an enum
Defines the datastore type for the map key when it is a temporal type
Defines the column details for the map key when stored in a join table
Defines the field(s) used for ordering the elements in this collection
Defines that ordering should be attributed by the implementation using a surrogate column.
Defines this method as being a callback for pre-persist events
Defines this method as being a callback for post-persist events
Defines this method as being a callback for pre-remove events
Defines this method as being a callback for post-remove events
Defines this method as being a callback for pre-update events
Defines this method as being a callback for post-update events
Defines this method as being a callback for post-load events
Defines this field as being stored using a join table
Defines this field as being stored using a join table when containing non-entity objects.
Defines this field as being stored as a large object
Defines this field as storing temporal data
Defines this field as storing enumerated data
Defines a converter for this field/property
Defines the column where this field is stored
Defines a column for joining to either a join table or foreign key relation
Defines the columns for joining to either a join table or foreign key relation (1-1, 1-N, N-1)
Defines the details of an index when overriding the provider default.
Defines the details of a foreign key when overriding the provider default.
Defines a series of DataNucleus extensions (DataNucleus extension).

subsection.name: @Entity
subsection.p: This annotation is used when you want to mark a class as persistent. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Name of the entity (used in JPQL to refer to the class)

subsection.p: See the documentation for Class Mapping

subsection.name: @MappedSuperclass
subsection.p: This annotation is used when you want to mark a class as persistent but without a table of its own and being the superclass of the class that has a table, meaning that all of its fields are persisted into the table of its subclass. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Inheritance

subsection.name: @PersistenceAware
subsection.p: This annotation is used when you want to mark a class as knowing about persistence but not persistent itself. That is, it manipulates the fields of a persistent class directly rather than using accessors. This is a DataNucleus extension. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Class Mapping

subsection.name: @Embeddable
subsection.p: This annotation is used when you want to mark a class as persistent and only storable embedded in another object. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @Cacheable
subsection.p: This annotation is used when you want to mark a class so that instance of that class can be cached. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for L2 Cache

subsection.name: @Inheritance
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the inheritance persistence for this class. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Inheritance

subsection.name: @Table
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the table where objects of a class will be stored. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Any unique constraints to apply to the table
Details of indexes if wanting to override provider default

subsection.name: @SecondaryTable
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a secondary table where some fields of this class are stored in another table. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Join columns for the PK of the secondary table back to the primary table
Any unique constraints to apply to the table
Details of indexes if wanting to override provider default
Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default

subsection.p: See the documentation for Secondary Tables

subsection.name: @IdClass
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a primary-key class for the identity of this class. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Primary Keys

subsection.name: @DatastoreId
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to define that the class uses datastore-identity. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Strategy to use when generating the values for this field. Has possible values of GenerationType TABLE, SEQUENCE, IDENTITY, AUTO.
Name of the generator to use. See @TableGenerator and @SequenceGenerator
Name of the column for persisting the datastore identity value

subsection.name: @NonDurableId
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to define that the class uses nondurable identity. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @EntityListeners
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a class or classes that are listeners for events from instances of this class. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @NamedQueries
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a series of named (JPQL) queries that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.
subsection.b: Note that with DataNucleus you can also specify @NamedQueries on non-persistable classes
subsection.p: See the documentation for Named Queries

subsection.name: @NamedQuery
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a named (JPQL) query that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Symbolic name for the query. The query will be referred to under this name

subsection.b: Note that with DataNucleus you can also specify @NamedQuery on non-persistable classes
subsection.p: See the documentation for Named Queries

subsection.name: @NamedNativeQueries
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a series of named native (SQL) queries that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.
subsection.b: Note that with DataNucleus you can also specify @NamedNativeQueries on non-persistable classes
subsection.p: See the documentation for Named Native Queries

subsection.name: @NamedNativeQuery
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a named (SQL) query that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Symbolic name for the query. The query will be referred to under this name
Class into which the result rows will be placed

subsection.b: Note that with DataNucleus you can also specify @NamedNativeQuery on non-persistable classes
subsection.p: See the documentation for Named Native Queries

subsection.name: @NamedStoredProcedureQueries
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a series of named native stored procedure queries that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.
subsection.b: Note that with DataNucleus you can also specify @NamedStoredProcedureQueries on non-persistable classes
subsection.p: See the documentation for Named Stored procedures

subsection.name: @NamedStoredProcedureQuery
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a named stored procedure query that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Symbolic name for the query. The query will be referred to under this name
Name of the stored procedure in the datastore
Any parameter definitions for this stored procedure
Any result class(es) for this stored procedure (one per result set)
Any result set mapping(s) for this stored procedure (one per result set)
Any query hints for this stored procedure

subsection.b: Note that with DataNucleus you can also specify @NamedStoredProcedureQuery on non-persistable classes
subsection.p: See the documentation for Named StoredProcedures

subsection.name: @SqlResultSetMappings
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a series of result mappings for SQL queries that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @SqlResultSetMapping
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a mapping for the results of an SQL query and can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Symbolic name for the mapping. The mapping will be referenced under this name
Set of entities extracted from the SQL query
Set of columns extracted directly from the SQL query

subsection.name: @NamedEntityGraphs
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a series of named EntityGraphs that can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @NamedEntityGraph
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a named EntityGraph and can be used in this persistence unit. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Set of nodes in this EntityGraph

subsection.name: @PrePersist
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for pre-persist events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @PostPersist
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for post-persist events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @PreRemove
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for pre-remove events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @PostRemove
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for post-remove events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @PreUpdate
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for pre-update events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @PostUpdate
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for post-update events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @PostLoad
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a method that is a callback for post-load events. Specified on the method. It has no attributes.
See the documentation for Lifecycle Callbacks

subsection.name: @SequenceGenerator
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a generator using sequences in the datastore. It is scoped to the persistence unit. Specified on the class/field/method.

tr.td: Name of the underlying sequence that will be used
Number of values to be allocated each time (optional)

subsection.name: @TableGenerator
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a generator using a table in the datastore for storing the values. It is scoped to the persistence unit. Specified on the class/field/method.

tr.td: Name of the table to use
Catalog of the table to use
Schema of the table to use
Name of the primary key column for the table
Name of the value column for the table
Value to store in the PK column for the row used by this generator
Initial value for the table row (optional)
Number of values to be allocated each time (optional)
Index(es) if wanting to override the provider default

subsection.name: @DiscriminatorColumn
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the discriminator column for a class. Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Inheritance

subsection.name: @DiscriminatorValue
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the value to be stored in the discriminator column for a class (when used). Specified on the class.
See the documentation for Inheritance

subsection.name: @PrimaryKeyJoinColumns
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the names of the primary key columns when this class has a superclass. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Array of column definitions for the primary key
Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default

subsection.name: @PrimaryKeyJoinColumn
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the name of the primary key column when this class has a superclass. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Name of the associated PK column in the superclass
DDL to use for the column (everything except the column name). This must include the SQL type of the column
Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default

subsection.name: @AttributeOverride
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field of a superclass that has its column overridden. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @AttributeOverrides
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define fields of a superclass that have their columns overridden. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @AssociationOverride
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a 1-1/N-1 field of a superclass that has its column overridden. Specified on the class.

tr.td: Column information for the FK column

subsection.name: @AssociationOverrides
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define 1-1/N-1 fields of a superclass that have their columns overridden. Specified on the class.

subsection.name: @Id
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field to use for the identity of the class. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @Embedded
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field as being embedded. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @EmbeddedId
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field to use for the identity of the class when embedded. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @Version
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field as holding the version for the class. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @Basic
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field of the class as persistent. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Type of fetching for this field
Whether this field having a value is optional (can it have nulls)

subsection.p: See the documentation for Fields/Properties

subsection.name: @Transient
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field of the class as not persistent. Specified on the field/method.
See the documentation for Fields/Properties

subsection.name: @JoinTable
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a collection/map is stored using a join table. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Columns back to the owning object (with the collection/map)
Columns to the element object (stored in the collection/map)
Any unique constraints to apply to the table
Details of indexes if wanting to override provider default
Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default for the join columns
Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default for the inverse join columns

subsection.name: @CollectionTable
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a collection/map of non-entities is stored using a join table. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Columns back to the owning object (with the collection/map)
Any unique constraints to apply to the table
Details of indexes if wanting to override provider default
Details of foreign key if wanting to override provider default

subsection.name: @Lob
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field will be stored using a large object in the datastore. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @Temporal
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field is stored as a temporal type. It specifies the JDBC type to use for storage of this type, so whether it stores the date, the time, or both. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @Enumerated
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field is stored enumerated (not that it wasnt obvious from the type!). Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @OneToOne
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field represents a 1-1 relation. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Class at the other side of the relation
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Whether the field can store nulls.
Name of the field that owns the relation (specified on the inverse side)
Whether persist, update, delete, refresh operations are cascaded
Whether to remove orphans when either removing this side of the relation or when nulling the relation

subsection.p: See the documentation for 1-1 Relations

subsection.name: @OneToMany
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field represents a 1-N relation. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Class at the other side of the relation
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Name of the field that owns the relation (specified on the inverse side)
Whether persist, update, delete, refresh operations are cascaded
Whether to remove orphans when either removing this side of the relation or when nulling the relationremoving an element

subsection.p: See the documentation for 1-N Relations

subsection.name: @ManyToMany
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field represents a M-N relation. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Class at the other side of the relation
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Name of the field on the non-owning side that completes the relation. Specified on the owner side.
Whether persist, update, delete, refresh operations are cascaded

subsection.p: See the documentation for M-N Relations

subsection.name: @ManyToOne
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field represents a N-1 relation. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Class at the other side of the relation
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Whether the field can store nulls.
Whether persist, update, delete, refresh operations are cascaded

subsection.p: See the documentation for N-1 Relations

subsection.name: @ElementCollection
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define that a field represents a 1-N relation to non-entity objects. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Class at the other side of the relation
Whether the field should be fetched immediately

subsection.name: @Index (field/method - extension)
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to define an index for this field/property. Specified on the field/property.

subsection.name: @JdbcType
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to define the jdbc-type to use for this field/property. Specified on the field/property.

subsection.name: @ColumnPosition
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to define the column position to use for this field/property. Specified on the field/property.

tr.td: position of the column (first is "0", increasing)

subsection.name: @SharedRelation
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to define a field with a (1-N/M-N) relation as being "shared" so that a distinguisher column is added. Specified on the field/property.

tr.td: value to be stored in the distinguisher column for this relation field
Name of the distinguisher column for this relation field
Whether the distinguisher column should be part of the PK (when in a join table)

subsection.name: @ValueGenerator
subsection.p: This DataNucleus-extension annotation is used to allow use of non-JPA-standard value generators on a field/property. Specified on the field/property.

subsection.name: @GeneratedValue
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the generation of a value for a (PK) field. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Strategy to use when generating the values for this field. Has possible values of GenerationType TABLE, SEQUENCE, IDENTITY, AUTO.
Name of the generator to use. See @TableGenerator and @SequenceGenerator

subsection.name: @MapKey
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the field in the value class that represents the key in a Map. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Name of the field in the value class to use for the key. If no value is supplied and the field is a Map then it is assumed that the key will be the primary key of the value class. DataNucleus only supports this null value treatment if the primary key of the value has a single field.

subsection.name: @MapKeyTemporal
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the datastore type used for the key of a map when it is a temporal type. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @MapKeyEnumerated
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the datastore type used for the key of a map when it is an enum. Specified on the field/method.

subsection.name: @MapKeyColumn
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the column details for a key of a Map when stored in a join table. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Name of the column for the key

subsection.name: @OrderBy
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a field in the element class that is used for ordering the elements of the List when it is retrieved. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Name of the field(s) in the element class to use for ordering the elements of the List when retrieving them from the datastore. This is used by JPA "ordered lists" as opposed to JDO "indexed lists" (which always return the elements in the same order as they were persisted. The value will be a comma separated list of fields and optionally have ASC/DESC to signify ascending or descending

subsection.name: @OrderColumn
subsection.p: This annotation is used to definethat the JPA implementation will handle the ordering of the List elements using a surrogate column. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Name of the column to use.

subsection.name: @Convert
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a converter for the field/property. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Name of the embedded field to be converted (NOT YET SUPPORTED)
Whether we should disable any use of @Converter set to auto-apply

subsection.name: @Converter
subsection.p: This annotation is used to mark a class as being an attribute converter. Note that DataNucleus doesn't require this specifying against a converter class except if you want to set the "autoApply". Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Whether this converter should always be used when storing this java type

subsection.name: @Column
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the column where a field is stored. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: DDL to use for the column (everything except the column name). This must include the SQL type of the column

subsection.name: @JoinColumn
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the FK column for joining to another table. This is part of a 1-1, 1-N, or N-1 relation. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Name of the column in the other table that this is the FK for
DDL to use for the column (everything except the column name). This must include the SQL type of the column
Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default

subsection.name: @JoinColumns
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the FK columns for joining to another table. This is part of a 1-1, 1-N, or N-1 relation. Specified on the field/method.

tr.td: Foreign key details if wanting to override provider default

subsection.name: @UniqueConstraint
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define a unique constraint to apply to a table. It is specified as part of @Table, @JoinTable or @SecondaryTable.
See the documentation for Schema Constraints

subsection.name: @Index
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the details for an Index. It is specified as part of @Table, @JoinTable, @CollectionTable or @SecondaryTable.

tr.td: Columns to be included in this index of the form colName1, colName2

subsection.p: See the documentation for Schema Constraints

subsection.name: @ForeignKey
subsection.p: This annotation is used to define the details for a ForeignKey. It is specified as part of @JoinColumn, @JoinTable, @CollectionTable or @SecondaryTable.

tr.td: DDL for the FOREIGN KEY statement of the form FOREIGN KEY ( colExpr1 {, colExpr2}... ) REFERENCES tblIdentifier [ ( otherColExpr1 {, otherColExpr2}... ) ] [ ON UPDATE updateAction ] [ ON DELETE deleteAction ]

subsection.p: See the documentation for Schema Constraints

subsection.name: @Extensions
subsection.p: DataNucleus Extension Annotation used to define a set of extensions specific to DataNucleus. Specified on the class or field.

subsection.name: @Extension
subsection.p: DataNucleus Extension Annotation used to define an extension specific to DataNucleus. Specified on the class or field.
